minor_severity: {PRONOUN/m_c/subject/CAP} won't be moving into the nursery just yet.
{PRONOUN/m_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/m_c/choose/chooses} to continue {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} duties as usual for now.
comment: both the minor and major severity strings will appear in conjunction with either a litter guess or an announcement. Write them accordingly!
They should also start with a space in order to ensure there is a space between the announcement/litter sentence and the severity sentence.

unmated_parent: m_c had a {insert}, but refused to talk about their origin.
m_c had a {insert} with an unknown partner.
m_c had a {insert} and refused to talk about their progenitor.
m_c had a {insert} and is absolutely refusing to talk about it or acknowledge it at all.
No one knows who m_c has had {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} {insert} with, but {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/seem/seems} very happy watching over {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} little offspring in the nursery.
Whenever someone asks whether m_c will be alright raising {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} {insert} alone, {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} just {VERB/m_c/smile/smiles}, and reply that everything is going to work out fine.
A {insert}! m_c welcomes them happily, and seems unperturbed by the lack of a partner in the nursery with {PRONOUN/m_c/object}.
two_parents: In the nursery, m_c lies suckling a {insert}, r_c watching over them and purring so hard {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} body vibrates.
m_c and r_c's eyes meet over their {insert}, full of love for their growing family.
In the quiet of the nursery, in the nest they've spent so long preparing, m_c and r_c welcome a {insert}.

With {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} {insert} mewling at {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} belly, m_c's long pregnancy has finally given {PRONOUN/m_c/object} and r_c the expansion to their family they've been hoping and waiting for.

Even with r_c by {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} side, m_c doesn't feel ready to be a parent of this {insert}. But {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/promise/promises} to the tiny flailing limbs by {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} side that {PRONOUN/m_c/subject}'ll do {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} best, {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/swear/swears} on StarClan itself.

r_c has been waiting eagerly to meet {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} offspring. At m_c's invitation, {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/crawl/crawls} into the nursery, purring and joining m_c in licking their {insert} clean.

r_c has been impatient for the end of m_c's pregnancy, and when {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/hear/hears} m_c has gone into labor {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/drop/drops} what {PRONOUN/r_c/subject}{VERB/r_c/'re/'s} doing and {VERB/r_c/sprint/sprints} for the nursery, where m_c is bringing a {insert} into the world.

m_c is so, so grateful that {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} adorable {insert} is here - both thrilled to meet them, and thrilled that r_c can take a turn parenting while m_c finally takes a little break from the stuffy air of the nursery.
m_c and r_c were so busy worrying about and looking forward to the birth that it's only now that they look at their {insert}, and wonder what to name them.
Purring with r_c against {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} back, m_c feels like {PRONOUN/m_c/subject}{VERB/m_c/'re/'s} going to explode with love, looking at {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} tiny new {insert}.
dead_mate: m_c looks at {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} {insert}, choking on both a purr and a wail. How are {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} supposed to do this without r_c?
m_c sobs and pushes {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} new {insert} away from {PRONOUN/m_c/object}. They look far too much like r_c for m_c to stand the sight of them.
Cats call out, but m_c can't be convinced to go back to the nursery. Not with the new {insert} made from {PRONOUN/m_c/object} and r_c there, taunting m_c with what should have been.
Looking down at r_c's last gift to {PRONOUN/m_c/object}, m_c vows to protect {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} new {insert}.

It's so hard, so very, very, nearly insurmountably hard doing this without {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} mate, but m_c wouldn't change it for the world. This {insert} is the last piece of r_c {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/have/has}.
both_unmated: m_c gave birth to a {insert} with r_c, and is looking forward to co-parenting.
r_c sheepishly peeks into the nursery to see {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} {insert}. m_c looks surprised, but not unhappy, to see {PRONOUN/r_c/object} there, and welcomes {PRONOUN/r_c/object} in with a purr.
affair: m_c secretly had a {insert} with r_c.
m_c hopes that {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} {insert} doesn't look too much like r_c, otherwise questions might follow.
The newly arrived {insert} that m_c has just given birth to looks suspiciously like r_c.
death: The birth was stressful, and m_c is exhausted and still bleeding and really just wants to sleep. Unfortunately, {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/don't/doesn't} ever wake up again.

m_c wasn't expecting {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} birth to be so incredibly painful, and as the day wears on {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} condition deteriorates, leaving {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} {insert} mewling and trying to suckle a cooling body.

It breaks {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} heart that {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} won't get to be with {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} {insert} as they grow. m_c pants out instructions and pleads to {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} friends around {PRONOUN/m_c/object}, as the blood loss from birth slowly takes {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} life.
Though all looks fine, the Clan will wake to discover m_c's body cold in the nursery, {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} {insert} mewing in vain for their parent.

Though birth is always considered a difficult and risky event, no one thought they'd lose m_c to it, not after the {insert} was all born and seemed fine. They thought the blood loss was under control.
difficult_birth: The birth was stressful and m_c lost a lot of blood.
m_c pants, looking at {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} wonderful {insert} and deciding that the pain and blood loss was all worth it.
Weak with blood loss, m_c nevertheless purrs at the sight of {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} {insert}.
Though the blood loss did not make the birth any easier for m_c.
Though m_c seems overly exhausted and weak from the birth.
m_c wasn't expecting this birth to be so intensely painful.
Everyone says giving birth is difficult, but m_c feels like this one has been worse than most.
This will all be worth it, m_c groans, promising {PRONOUN/m_c/self} that as the pains of afterbirth rock {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} exhausted and bleeding body.
m_c chokes down the herbs given to {PRONOUN/m_c/object}, retching at the taste but knowing {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/need/need} them to stop the blood loss.
outside_alone: Rumors reach the Clan that m_c gave birth to a {insert}.
outside_death: Some say m_c didn't make it.
